message.content: This question requires knowledge about animal adaptation and camouflage. Arctic foxes are white in order to blend in with their snowy environment and effectively hide from their predators. Option (A) is incorrect because hiding from predators is the purpose of their white fur. Option (C) is partially true because their fur does provide insulation and help keep their bodies warm in cold arctic temperatures, but this is not the main reason for their white color. Option (D) is not related to the reason why Arctic foxes are white.

Option (C) is incorrect because their white fur does not directly contribute to keeping their bodies warm. Option (D) is incorrect because keeping their fur clean is not the main reason for their white coloration, although it may be a secondary benefit.
